titleStmt.title: Chancellorsville and Daily Graphic to Walt Whitman, 1 October 1875
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman
titleStmt.sponsor: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities, University of Nebraska-Lincoln
titleStmt.funder: The National Endowment for the Humanities

address.addrLine: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: As these notes are written on scrap paper torn from a letter to Whitman of October 1, 1875, this manuscript was written sometime after that date, possibly as Whitman was preparing Memoranda During the War (1875–1876).
The following are responsible for particular readings or for changes to this file, as noted: Elizabeth Lorang Brett Barney Tim Jackson Ashley Lawson
The verso of the manuscript leaf is letterhead of The Graphic Company, New York, with a date and partial salutation written in an unknown hand.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Handwritten note on a small paper fragment, which reads: "Chancellorsville—May 2, 3, 1863. Gettysburg—Jul 1, 2, 3,—'63."
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman Ephemera, University of Tulsa
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

revisionDesc.change: corrections made based on additional review by KP, BB, and LL
